title: Rosemary Brown Sugar Coffee Syrup
directions: Combine brown sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir until sugar fully dissolves.
Add rosemary sprig and simmer gently for 5-10 minutes, depending on desired herb intensity.
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract if using.
Remove rosemary sprig and strain through a fine-mesh sieve if needed.
Let cool before transferring to a syrup bottle. Store in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.
notes: If syrup is too runny: simmer longer (2-5 more minutes), add 1-2 tbsp more brown sugar, or add 1 tsp honey/molasses while warm. Syrup will thicken further as it cools. Works great in lattes, cold brew, and Americanos. Optional add-ins: cinnamon stick, orange zest, thyme sprig, or a pinch of nutmeg. For a winter version add cinnamon + clove + orange zest. For a lighter herbal version add thyme + lemon peel.
